title: Galloisiana
text:
Galloisiana is a genus of <a href="insect">insect</a>s in the family <a href="Grylloblattidae">Grylloblattidae</a> found in East Asia. It contains 12 species.
Species.
These species belong to the genus "Galloisiana":
Range and habitat.
In Japan, "Galloisiana" species prefer rocky areas and cool, moist environments, where they are frequently found near streams (often under rocks) in well developed forests. Unlike the "<a href="Grylloblatta">Grylloblatta</a>" species of North America, they are not known to forage in snowfields. They are most abundant in montane habitats in central <a href="Honshu">Honshu</a>. In central Honshu, "Galloisiana" specimens have been collected in the following mountains and mountain ranges.
Specimens have also been collected in <a href="Shikoku">Shikoku</a>, which are genetically close to specimens from the <a href="Suzuka%20Mountains">Suzuka Mountains</a>.
Diet.
"Galloisiana" species are generalist scavengers that feed on both plant and animal materials.
